text: hey guys we are super excited we just

lighter and more efficient than their
traditional panels we have five panels
500 watts we're gonna get these babies
installed show you how they look and how
they work yep and here's the install on
our RV as you can see we have more than
enough space for a few more of these
panels if we decide 500 watts isn't
enough our panels are glued down with
Sikaflex 221 on the back we put dyke' or
around the edges to give it a little
more finished look even though it's not
really necessary screws weren't
necessary for the panel's but we did
have to use a few screws here to hold
down the wires but for us the less
screws the less potential for leaks the
advantage to these flex panels is damps
all the powers amount of crystalline
panel but with a few extra perks they're
80 percent lighter than a standard glass
panel and they're only 1/8 inch thin and
they're flexible which makes them more
aerodynamic and they fit to this light
curve varoom
the neatest part of all they're super
durable so you can walk right on them
and no more tiptoeing around on the roof
the kit comes with a solar controller to
monitor the batteries and prevent
overcharging today's pretty hazy and
cloudy but we're still bringing in 20
amps the controller displays the solar
charge coming in the current battery
levels and of course the nifty power
boost technology that tops up our
batteries at the end of the day to keep
us powered through the night these solar
flex panels are spanking new solar
technology and after three months to use
we're loving them yes hope to see on the
